bug.short_desc: Warn when a namespace prefix is overwritten by a local variable

long_desc.thetext:
The following code causes the namespaced classes to not be loaded. It's a "stupid programmer" bug, but it would be nice if the generator could warn about it:
var xyz = new xyz.MyClass();
*** Even the lint job doesn't catch this. ***
A nice warning would be something like,
Warning: Class name xyz shadowed by local variable at filename:linenum

(In reply to comment #0)
> A nice warning would be something like, > > Warning: Class name xyz shadowed by local variable at filename:linenum
Or more accurately,
Warning: Namespace xyz shadowed by local variable at filename:linenum
Agree wit you Derrell, a warning here would be nice.

I agree, such a warning could be really helpful.
This might go without saying: if such a warning would be implemented, I hope it will also take into account any libraries used.
I've fallen into this trap multiple times myself, using the Svg contrib. The contrib has namespace 'svg' and I keep finding myself writing "var svg = ..."
